title: Mastering Teacher-Librarian Collaborative Instructional Design: Application in Language Education Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational language education experience and digital literacy
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented course applying a teacher-librarian collaborative model to language education in a smartphone-based VR simulation environment. Operates field-immersive scenarios and project-based assessment systems

learning_goals: Learners can identify and operationalize three or more effective communication strategies for building collaborative instructional partnerships.
Learners can apply teacher-librarian collaboration guidelines for integrating information literacy in language education with over 80% accuracy in a VR simulation environment.
Teams can develop project-based assessment tools to strengthen learner-centered information utilization competencies, undergo peer evaluation, and submit final outputs.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
